title: Adding new account
creator: wpjohns
content:
I am setting up a new computer with Linux Mint and Thunderbird. I got my primary comcast.net account added in and working but when trying to add another account I get the following:

Unable to connect

The connection was refused when attempting to contact localhost. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Thunderbird is permitted to access the web.

Since the first account works, I assume there is no problem with network connection, firewalls, or proxy settings. I have confirmed spellings of username and password. Any ideas?

title: Hilton ics file import fails
creator: phil102
content:
The Hilton hotel reservation produces the following .ics file (with some edits for privacy), which fails on import. Deleting lines like the second block will import correctly. I can make this edit when needed, so this is more of a bug report than a question. I have not tried to narrow it down more, this is something I do once every couple of months.

title: Copying Thunderbird to new laptop
creator: Indylu7
content:
Hello. I have followed the instructions to copy the profile file to a drive and take it to the new computer so my Thunderbird will be the same on both laptops.

BUT I get a message that the profile file is not available. And I searched for the file by name and found nothing!

The actual message is attached.

I need to copy my emails to the new laptop.

title: Sync local inbox file to server
creator: gursdeepak
content:
I was using a web mail client and it deleted my inbox. I have a backup of Inbox and Inbox.msf file on my local computer and keep copying it into the correct folder, but every time I start Thunderbird, it syncs from the server down and deletes all the messages in my inbox file.

How do I tell it to sync the local messages back up to the server or is there a good/better way to do it?

title: export address book
creator: vanboxtel.mc
content: I'd like to export the Thunderbird address book and archived emails from an old MacBook Air (2013) so I can use the adresses in a different email program on a new computer, and so I can save the archived emails. When I choose "Export" in Thunderbird, it creates a zip file of all the data, but unfortunately there's no way to unzip that zip file. Is there another way to save the address book and archived messages? Kind regards, Marie-Cécile van Boxtel

title: thunderbird
creator: info13520
content:
Hello, since friday, 6.2. thunderbird does not launch new (and also not completely all older) Emails anymore. So I can't see all my recieved and send E-Mails. In all my 3 Mail-Accounts froms different providers it does not work anymore, without changing anything from my side I know. But from my handy, where I use google-Mail, it works.

I already checked synchronization settings and repaired the E-Mail-folders.

So, are there any technical defects or problems with thunderbird, an update for instance that caused trouble for instance? And what can I do, to make it work again? Atherwise I would have to quit thunderbird and change my Host.

Looking forward to your response and already thanks for support, all the best, M.

title: Thunderbird
creator: stephenmathews
content: Hi Just started using Thunderbird. Every time I start Thunderbird it ask for passwords. As they are long and secure its tedious. I tried the solution previously shown on your web help (click "Outgoing Server" Click Edit. Under "Security and Authentication" DESELECT "Use name and password") but it doesnt give a "username and password opyion" only a box for Connection security, another for Authentication method, another for User name. Whats the best solution please?

title: Disable "Use Alternatie Text" permanently?
creator: Arno_Peeters
content: There surely must be a way to permanently disable the nag for "Alternate text" when editing an image in an email? I don't want it, need it, use it... There use to be an extension for it, but that is obsolete by now. Can it be done in the Config editor?
